Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: நாடாது நட்டலிற் கேடில்லை நட்டபின் வீடில்லை நட்பாள் பவர்க்கு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: As those who are of a friendly nature will not forsake (a friend) after once loving (him), there is no evil so great as contracting a friendship without due inquiry.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown carelessly and hastily shaking hands with a stranger, forming a friendship without any investigation ('நாடாது நட்டல்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: The moment the handshake is complete, the bond of friendship is visualized as a set of heavy, unbreakable, magical shackles that instantly lock around both of their wrists.
Layered_Composition.Background: The stranger is then revealed to be a treacherous or harmful person. The first person, who is of a loyal nature, cannot now escape the bond ('வீடில்லை'), and is dragged down into a dark pit of ruin ('கேடு') by the bad friend they chose without thinking.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: There is no greater source of ruin than forming a friendship without investigation, because for a loyal person, such a friendship, once made, is inescapable.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The magical, unbreakable shackles that form upon the handshake are the central metaphor for the inescapable bond of friendship for a loyal person.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The scene begins with a naive brightness that instantly turns dark and ominous the moment the shackles lock. The pit of ruin glows with a menacing red light.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot that captures the rash handshake and the immediate, magical appearance of the inescapable shackles.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: A dramatic shift from light to dark.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Dark fantasy, with a strong moral.

Negative_Prompt: person investigating the stranger, breakable shackles, text artifacts, cartoonish.
